results.title: Gift
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Gift was shot in the Wolfen-Bitterfeld region of Germany, formerly part of the GDR. Home to intensive chemical production powered by local open-cut coalmines, Bitterfeld has been referred to as the filthiest city in Europe. Since the reunification of Germany, attempts have been made to redress the environmental damage, but the long-term effects remain evident in both the scarred landscape, and the poor health statistics of the people who live there. Gift is a mesmeric, impressionistic collage of images of industry, mining, pollution and community.

Gift is the German word for poison

results.title: Gidget goes to Rome
results.creator_credit: Jerry Bresler, Jerry Bresler Productions and Paul Wendkos
results.brief_description: Gidget Goes to Rome is the third film to be made inspired by the sun-happy and beach-loving characters created by Frederick Kohner in the mid 50s. In this film, Francie “Gidget” Lawrence goes to Italy with her boyfriend, Moondoggie, and their friends for a whirlwind tour of Rome. Although chaperoned by Aunt Albertina, the two aren’t stopped from experiencing brief extracurricular flirtations. Cast includes: Cindy Carol, James Darren, Jesse Royce Landis, Cesare Danova, Danielle de Metz and Joby Baker.

results.title: Gidget goes Hawaiian
results.creator_credit: Jerry Bresler, Columbia Pictures, Jerry Bresler Productions and Paul Wendkos
results.brief_description: Francie Lawrence, better known as Gidget, is off on a Hawaiian holiday with her parents after being disappointed in love by her surfing boyfriend, Moondoggie. Gidget manages to conquer the boys on Waikiki with her good looks, dancing ability and naturally, her surfing prowess, but complications ensue when Moondoggie arrives unannounced. Gidget finds herself caught in a love triangle involving Moondoggie and newcomer dancing stud, Eddie Horner. Things get even worse when jealous rival, Abbey, starts a vicious rumour about Gidget having had “an unfortunate experience”, which causes an even bigger stir with her parents. Cast includes Deborah Walley, James Darren and Michael Callan.

results.title: Gidget
results.creator_credit: Lewis Rachmil, Columbia Pictures and Paul Wendkos
results.brief_description: A classic teenage film filled with sun, surf and romance. Sandra Dee became the stereotypical blonde haired blue-eyed surfer girl in this first Gidget movie. Francie Lawrence desperately wants to find true love at 16, and becomes a mascot for a group of college-bound surfer boys and their drop-out leader the Great Kahoona, played by Cliff Robertson. During the summer vacation she becomes attracted to Moondoggie played by James Darren. Gidget does everything to make him fall for her and by the end of the summer her dreams come true.

results.title: Gideon's trumpet
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and Sidney Galanty
results.brief_description: This is the story of a trial that actually took place in a quiet southeast part of the United States. The accused, Clarence Earl Gideon, a friendless drifter, launched a strange two year battle that would change the law. Based on the book by Anthony Lewis.

results.title: Gibraltar: Gateway to the Mediterranean
results.brief_description: The present political and economic situation in Gibraltar. Highlights historic events; emphasises the strategic importance ; its development as a naval base and the value of tis airstrip. Discusses the controversy with Spain. Shows familiar tourist attractions.

results.title: Giantland
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, United Artists Corporation and Burt Gillett
results.brief_description: Mickey tells a crowd of orphans a version of “Jack and the Beanstalk” in which he plays the leading role and takes on Rumplewatt, the “king of the giants - prince of the tyrants.”

results.title: Giant turtles
results.brief_description: Shows sea turtles coming ashore by night to lay their eggs before returning to the water. Also shows the hatching of the baby turtles two months later and their instinctive race for the water.

results.title: Giant molecules (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Demonstrates addition and condensation polymerization reactions, and indicates how physical properties and molecular shape of polymers may be related. Four polymers are shown, and the differences in their properties are explained using models. Finally, materials are shown being turned into the more familiar plastic consumer goods.

results.title: Giant in the sun
results.creator_credit: Victor M. Gover, Northern Nigeria Information Services and Sidney Samuelson
results.brief_description: This film discusses the land and people of northern Nigeria. It covers the ancient cities of Kano, Sokoto, Ilorin and Katsina, with the dazzling spectacle of the Sallah, presided over by the Emir. Shows traditional crafts flourishing alongside modern developments in industry, education, health and welfare. (Award: Grand Award at the Third African Film Festival, 1959).
